action.action-desc: Ms. DeLauro (for herself, Ms. Chu, Ms. Sánchez, Mr. Takano, Mrs. Hayes, Ms. Norton, Mrs. Ramirez, Mr. McGovern, Mr. Lynch, Ms. Scholten, Mrs. Watson Coleman, Ms. Velázquez, Mr. Nadler, Mr. Magaziner, Ms. Jayapal, Mr. Pocan, Ms. Schakowsky, and Mr. García of Illinois) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to prohibit employment of children in tobacco-related agriculture by deeming such employment as oppressive child labor.

section.text: This Act may be cited as Children Don't Belong on Tobacco Farms Act.
Section 3(l) of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 (29 U.S.C. 203(l)) is amended—
